bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Morris (1903-1997) was a long-time labor journalist, principally for the Communist Party USA's newspapers, the Daily Worker (national newspaper) and the Western Worker, their successor titles, and was also at one time head of the Party's National Labor Commission. Born to Jewish parents in the Ukraine, he came to the United States at age sixteen and was one of the founding members of the Communist Party USA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains: (Box 1): Autobiography, 6 pp., 1981; Speech at Lenin 100th birthday conference; GM article, published in Soviet Contemporary; Letters to PDW editorial board, 1979-1986; Letters to Gus Hall, 1978-1986; Correspondence with Henry Winston, 1973-1986; “Letters” 1968-1984; “Correspondence” 1973-1985; including George Myers, Carl Winter, Mike Zagarell; Testimonials, dinners 1970s-1980s; Articles and speeches on trade union matters c. 1979 - c. 1986. (Box 2): Research material for American Labor: Which Way (1961), c. early 1970s; Harry Bridges letter, 5/3/1971; Research material for CIA and American Labor: The Subversion of the AFL-CIO's Foreign Policy (1967); “Historical trade union materials," 1960s-70s.
